isis.stitle: BP-R1 BOBTAIL BRAKE PROPORTIONING RELAY VALVE AND LQ-5 BOBTAIL LIMITING VALVE - SERVICE CHECKS - LQ-5 OPERATION TEST

svcproc.title: LQ-5 OPERATION TEST
svcproc.para: To properly test the LQ-5, use a pair of test gauges or gauges with known accuracy.

step1.para: With the trailer air supply valve pushed in (tractor-trailer mode), install two air gauges in the front axle service system: one air gauge between the LQ-5 and the brake control valve (foot valve) and one air gauge at a front axle air chamber.
Build system air pressure to governor cut-out setting.

Make a slow, partial service brake application with the brake control valve (foot valve) and have an observer read the gauges. When the gauge between the LQ-5 and the brake control valve (foot valve) reaches 40 psi, the gauge at the front axle brake chamber should read approximately 20 psi (±5 psi).
Make a full service brake application. Both gauges should read the same pressure.
With the trailer air supply valve pulled out (bobtail mode), make a 30-40 psi service brake application. Both gauges should read the same pressure.

svcproc.para: If the LQ-5 fails the OPERATION TEST, repair or replace the LQ-5.
